text:
Our Java application GUI uses mutliple JSVGCanvas components to render various 
SVG's to help our users. Depending on the panel that is being displayed, about 
2-8 JSVGCanvas components are displayed. During the display of these SVG's we 
are seeing the Swing GUI lock, completely freezing the application. We see the 
application freeze quite frequently when running with a Pentium 4 2.4GHZ CPU or 
above using Windows 2000 with the application started via Java WebStart. Below 
is a full thread dump when our application is deadlocked. It would appear that 
Batik uses multiple threads to render/handle text. This results in a classic 
deadlock where:

	Thread-135 has locked <0x0526ca80> (a sun.font.TrueTypeFont)
	Thread-135 is waiting to lock <0x0520dd10> (a [Lsun.font.FileFont;)

	Thread-136 has locked <0x0520dd10> (a [Lsun.font.FileFont;)
	Thread-136 is waiting to lock <0x0526ca80> (a sun.font.TrueTypeFont)

	AWT-EventQueue is waiting to lock <0x0520dd10> (a [Lsun.font.FileFont;) 
but can't proceed because 
	Thread135 and Thread136 are deadlocked thus causing the Swing GUI to 
freeze.

    
I can't send you a test case to reproduce this problem as I can only get it to 
occur in our application and only when using Java Webstart. The best I can do 
is the full thread dump which is below. Having worked on thread problems 
before, I know they can be very sporadic and sometimes very difficult to 
reproduce. I realize that this an older version of your code (1.1.x) but I 
think it is very important for one of your developers to look at the thread 
dump and see if it could occur in Batik 1.6. If no one else has encountered it 
until now, it could very likely still be a bug in Batik 1.6, which we are 
currently looking at migrating to. 

We are compiling our code under j2sdk1.4.2_06 and running the client bytecode 
using J2SE Runtime 5.0 update 2.

creator: dvanwate@mail.donaldson.com
dvanwate@mail.donaldson.com
text: Sorry, I sent you multiple thread dumps. The relevant dump is the last one.

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
This is by all appearences a bug in the jdK (the locked threads are
all in JDK calls, none of the offending locks are held by Batik).

As far as occuring in 1.6 I would doubt it as in version 1.6 
(actually perhaps as early as 1.5) we call getAvailableFontFamilyNames 
in one place and cache the results.  This would probably avoid the
deadlock.

This is an ancient version of Batik, I would strongly recommend 
upgrading.
